required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Postoperative Changes in Head and Neck Cancer Patients Undergoing Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Postoperative Changes in Head and Neck Cancer Patients Undergoing Surgery

lead_sponsor.agency: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

clinical_study.source: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate the postoperative changes after a major surgery in head and neck cancer patients. Each participant will be evaluated three times: (1) One day before surgery; (2) one month postoperative and (3) three months postoperative. Assessments included blood pressure, anthropometric measurements, physical measurements and questionnaires on quality of life, nutritional status and cancer symptoms.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessments one day before surgery, 1 and 3 months postoperative
primary_outcome.description: Functional exercise capacity is measured by a 6-minute walk test

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessments one day before surgery, 1 and 3 months postoperative
secondary_outcome.description: Muscle fatigability is measured using a Cybex dynamometer

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessments one day before surgery, 1 and 3 months postoperative
secondary_outcome.description: Flexibility is measured by Toe touch test

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessments one day before surgery, 1 and 3 months postoperative
secondary_outcome.description: Flexibility is measured by sit and reach test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in upper body strength and endurance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessments one day before surgery, 1 and 3 months postoperative
secondary_outcome.description: Upper body strength and endurance are measured by the 30-second arm curl test

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessments one day before surgery, 1 and 3 months postoperative
secondary_outcome.description: Hand grip strength test is performed using a Jamar® dynamometer

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in health-related quality of life
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessments one day before surgery, 1 and 3 months postoperative
secondary_outcome.description: Health-related quality of life is evaluated with the version 4 of the University of Washington head and neck cancer questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in common symptom batteries in cancer patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessments one day before surgery, 1 and 3 months postoperative
secondary_outcome.description: Common symptom batteries is measured by the Edmonton Symptom Assessment System (revised version) questionnaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessments one day before surgery, 1 and 3 months postoperative
secondary_outcome.description: Nutritional status is measured with the Short Nutritional Assessment Questionnaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessments one day before surgery, 1 and 3 months postoperative
secondary_outcome.description: Resting blood pressure is measured using the M6 Comfort automatic blood pressure monitor

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessments one day before surgery, 1 and 3 months postoperative
secondary_outcome.description: Weight (kg) is measured by using a bioelectrical impedance analysis

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessments one day before surgery, 1 and 3 months postoperative
secondary_outcome.description: Fat body mass (%) is measured by using a bioelectrical impedance analysis

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessments one day before surgery, 1 and 3 months postoperative
secondary_outcome.description: Waist circumference is measured with a non-elastic tape measure

study_pop.textblock: Adults with head and neck cancer planned for an elective major surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of head and neck cancer patients planned for an elective major surgery
- More than 18 years of age
- Able to read, write and understand French
Exclusion Criteria:
- Neurological or orthopedic impairments not suitable for testing
